РЕКАМЕНДУЮ!

The game even though cheap is not worth the price.  The game has a ridiculous amount of bugs and technical problems.  There are several balanced issues both as survivor and killer than make 90% of matches very one sided. If you have several friends to play with as survivor the game can be fun time to time but this game is not welcoming toward new players.  Most skilled players use the same perks such as decisive strike, self care, hex ruin, no ed and well as a few others.  It makes most matches feel stale and the difference in killer is the only real variable that changes.  Most of my friends have quit this game and most updates seem to be focused on the store for cosmetic purchases rather than fixing the glaring issues that this game has.  Most players both killer and survivor act like children and disconnect from games when things don't go their way which ends up ruining the experience for all the remaining players.

There are better multiplayer games to play with friends with. If you don't care how you do as killer or survivor and don't take the game too seriously then it may be for you but every one else, stay far away unless there are serious changes.

Es muy buena el juego. Sin embargo, molesta mucho que los desarrolladores se centren más en beneficiar a los jugadores que juegan el rol de "Asesinos" y no a los "Supervivientes". Esto causa que con cada actualización se vuelva más tediosos jugar de Superviviente, y sea mucho más facilistas para los asesinos.

Игра хоть и имеет большую популярность, но мне она категорически не понравилась. По 3 причинам. 1-ое сис. требования пускай они соотвествуют моему пк, но сравнивая с графикой это уж слишком. 2-ое весит 30гб очень очень много для нее, так как там ничего нет почти, один короткий геймплей. 3-е как и говорил очень короткий геймплей, два режима (убивай или беги) очень скучно, так еще за скидочные 250р, так еще и с донатом. Игру в 100% бесплатной, тогда бы я наиграл в нее хотя бы часов 20 от силы. А так я не вижу смысла играть в неё вообще за такие деньги, пускай 250р это не много. Но зная какие игры делают за те же 250 р, можно найти очень много игр за ту же стоимость. Донесите разрабочикам, игру во многом надо расширять, либо делать её бесплатной. И возможно даже при помощи этого, её можно очень сильно популязировать. Моя общая оценка этой игре 3 из 10 (в игре есть и плюсы, но они на фоне мною представленных мною проблем они кажется незаметными

I love PVP games period. I love DBD, because it is so different compared to most pvp games. The strategy and skill curve is great. I love the variety of killers and perks. The only negative I have to say is that I wish the survivors had something special about them that helped them in game. Once you get the perks unlocked they just become skins basically. I just wish that had different stats at the very least. It is just overall fun for those PVP lovers though.

There are a lot of retards and a lot of nice people, like everywhere

I really love this game, it's one my favorite games to play with friends. Even though it's the same task over and over it doesn't get boring that fast if you don't have other things to do. I like it when i go into a game not knowing what kind of killer i'm gonna be up against and what kind of playstyle og how good they are. my teamates are the same. sometimes you have to hope your teamates will be good and know what to do in different situasions. This game is not for anyone, if you like horror, jumpscares, listening after the smallest breath your character makes, teamwork, slaughter, chasing or being chased. this game might be for you. I must say it takes getting used to the map layout, killers, perks, loops and skill checks but it will all be worth it when you get better at it. I main survivor since i love the thrill of being chased and getting away with it. plus i suck at killer. 

I would recommend this game since you can also get funny comments in the waiting room or the end of the game where everyone can see the chat including the killer.

One thing i really don't like in this game in killers are tunnelers and campers/face campers. Camping/face camping is when you are hooked and the killer either patrolls or stays right in front of the hook until you die, it is not practical in any way for the survivors OR the killer since the survivors if they don't know how won't be able to save, and the killer is just wasting time. Tunneling is when you as a survivor gets unhooked the killer goes after you and not the other guy who unhooked you. This is an easy way to kill a survivor but is unfun for the other one and you as a killer might get blown in the face in the after game chat by tunneling. 

Survivors can be toxic. this means that they flash the flashlight or teabags the killer either in mid chase of at the end of the game right outside of the gate where you can just escape. another way to be toxic is to loop the killer for a REALLY long time plus having decisive strike (perk) or something and hit it so that when the killer finally gets you down and goes to pick you up you use decisive strike to get of his shoulder and then begin the loop all over again.

If you are gonna play this game just expect toxic people, since this community has a lot of it. But it's not always toxic. Just play it and have fun. I hope this review helped in a way.

Between PS4 and PC, I have about 600-700 hours of time put into playing Dead By Daylight. When I started playing, as a survivor, it was incredibly thrilling and scary as you figured out which killer you were facing and would get jump scared fairly frequently. However, this feeling fades rather quickly the more dedicated to the game you are. There are a few killers who still manage to jump scare, such as Michael Myers or any of the other stealth killers, as well as Spirit and Hag. That being said, if you enjoy playing with your friends, survivor may be for you as working together with your team can be highly satisfying and make the game much easier to ease into. If you prefer to play solo, I would definitely recommend investing in playing killer (though you can still solo queue as a survivor). Besides actually learning the game, you also need to have or learn to have a great deal of patience, as the game itself still has many issues. For example, dedicated servers have been out for around a month now, and have brought new bugs to the game that didn't exist before. The devs are obviously aware of the issues, but it takes them time to fix, test, and release to public. However, they are great at consistently releasing content as we get a new killer/survivor pretty much every three months. Final verdict: If you are interested in this type of game, and you see this on sale, pick it up and try it out, or wait for a free weekend. It can be a lot of fun, but also very frustrating. See you in the fog o7
